intro: Hypochaeris corsica, commonly known as the Corsican mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small yellow flowers that are followed by fluffy seed heads, aiding in wind dispersal. Hypochaeris corsica is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
